intro: Corydalis boweri, commonly known as the Bower's larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at elevations between 1,500 and 3,000 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are slender and branching. Corydalis boweri is a perennial herb that thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows.
